main.name: Max Hubbard
main.description: I am a self-taught programmer and student at the University of Massachusetts Commonwealth Honors College studying Computer Science
main.bio: I'm a senior at the University of Massachusetts, Amherst and a software engineer who loves to help people learn and explore. I have experience creating applications used in clinical research at a Boston hospital that aim to help aid in the health and wellness of patients with ALS (Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis) commonly known as Lou Gehrig's disease. Keeping this in mind, I strive to create applications that not just researchers will use but that the patients themselves will use. I also have wide experience with relational and non-relational databases and even assist in teaching a course at UMass on the subject. When I'm not programming, I enjoy playing baseball and am even an umpire for my local town's Little League.

education.description: Software Engineering, Computer Graphics, Algorithms, Project Management, Game Design, Data Management, Natural Language Processing, Operating Systems, Mobile App Development, Linear Algebra, Multivariate Calculus

work.title: Undergraduate Teaching Assistant
work.description: Undergraduate Teaching Assistant for the course Applications of Data Management. Solidified over 100 studentsâ€™ understanding of course topics by holding office hours and communicating with students through an online forum, Piazza.

work.title: Software Engineer Intern
work.description: Created an automated performance testing framework for the FX, Cash, and Listed Derivatives team in order to help simplify testing and prevent bugs before product release. Designed a process to generate a bulk amount of customizable orders that can be imported into databases easily to help with creating large amounts of data.
